<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>MJ Eberhart, who goes by the trail name Nimblewill Nomad, became the </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/article/lifestyle-environment-and-nature-alabama-maine-07890eda2a8dc653bb69c68629e20a8f?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">oldest person ever</a></span><span> to complete the 2,193-mile Appalachian Trail at age 83.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Larry Tractenberg </span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/darrenrovell/status/1457355164004851718?s=20" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">finished</a></span><span> the NYC Marathon in just over five hours, 51 years after he ran the city’s first marathon in 1970.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So there you have it: You’re never too old. Brb about to shoot some jumpers.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">—<em>Neal Freyman</em></p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AUTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/07/elon-musk-posts-twitter-poll-asking-if-he-should-sell-10-of-his-tesla-shares?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
2021 in a Headline
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/07/elon-musk-posts-twitter-poll-asking-if-he-should-sell-10-of-his-tesla-shares?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt='Headline saying "Twitter has spoken: Musk should sell $21 billion Tesla stake" ' style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/bedd537195afe0a61500f960cb35cd44676216fb-2048x1897.png?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Screenshot of Bloomberg.com </em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">*Record Scratch* *Freeze Frame* You’re probably wondering how we got here.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Saturday, Elon Musk proposed selling 10% of his Tesla stock, which is worth roughly $21 billion. And instead of, you know, consulting with advisors or lawyers, he did it the Elon Musk way: by creating a <a href="https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1457064697782489088?s=20" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">poll on Twitter</a> and asking his followers to vote. He said he would “abide by the results of this poll.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">3.5 million votes later, and 58% of respondents said he should sell.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">So what happens next?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If Musk sticks to his word and unloads the stock, then he could end up with long-term capital gains tax liability of <a href="https://twitter.com/RyanRadia/status/1457437788639571984?s=20" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$6.69 billion</a>, according to estimates by economics researcher Ryan Radia. Can you think of a bigger individual tax bill in history? We can’t.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Tesla’s stock price will be interesting to watch this morning, but experts say Musk’s $21 billion tweet may not be too much of a curveball for current shareholders, because his intentions to sell some of his Tesla shares <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/11/06/elon-musk-is-using-a-twitter-poll-to-decide-the-future-of-his-tesla-stock.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">are well known</a>:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Speaking at the Code Conference in September, Musk said he’d sell a “huge block” of his expiring stock options in Q4.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>And two weeks ago he said he’d sell $6 billion worth of stock and donate it to the UN’s World Food Programme (WFP), provided they open their books and prove that that amount would end world hunger.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Reading between the lines: </strong>Musk appears to have already made up his mind about selling Tesla stock, but he wanted to have some fun on Twitter before doing it.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The tax angle</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Musk’s rising fortune ($338 billion at last count) has been the focus of a proposed “<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/26/undefined?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">billionaire’s tax</a>” that would hit the unrealized gains of the richest 700 or so Americans. While that proposal faces an uphill battle in Congress, it reflects growing concern about tax avoidance by the top 0.01%, whose riches are tied up in investments that aren’t taxed until they’re sold.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sen. Ron Wyden, who introduced the billionaire’s tax, said, “Whether or not the world’s wealthiest man pays any taxes at all shouldn’t depend on the results of a Twitter poll.”</p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/07/why-the-infrastructure-bill-is-a-big-deal?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Why the BIF Is a BFD
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The House <a href="https://www.axios.com/house-approves-infrastructure-bill-36cc16f0-480e-402a-a260-ff17976184f7.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">passed</a> the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act, known as BIF, late Friday night, putting an end to the long-running joke that Congress could never close the deal on an infrastructure bill. It’ll head to President Biden’s desk for his signature.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why it matters: </strong>If the supply chain mayhem has taught us anything, it’s that the economic machine can’t function without the right nuts and bolts in place. The Business Roundtable, an influential group of US execs, called the bill “vital for the economy” and urged its passage.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Plus, even in an era where Democrats and Republicans are going at it like rival San Diego TV stations, the bill earned bipartisan support. In the summer, the Senate passed it on a 69–30 vote.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">BIF 101: </strong>The bill provides $550 billion in new funding for infrastructure projects like bridges, broadband, and EV charging stations—and represents the biggest federal investment in infrastructure in more than a decade. It’ll be paid for mostly by Covid relief funds that haven’t been spent and a crackdown on taxes for crypto trading.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>with Part 1 of their economic agenda done and dusted, Democrats turn to Part 2: the $1.75 trillion social spending bill. Before voting, lawmakers are waiting to hear from the nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office about how much it would cost American taxpayers.</p>
</div>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRAVEL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/07/us-relaxes-pandemic-era-travel-restrictions-for-foreign-visitors?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Make America Touristy Again
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/07/us-relaxes-pandemic-era-travel-restrictions-for-foreign-visitors?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Squid game character saying we're excited to welcome you" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2021-11-07/image-a55358ac74925ab75073c2e1838048878652409c-480x270-gif/giphy(11).gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Squid game character saying we're excited to welcome you" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2021-11-07/image-a55358ac74925ab75073c2e1838048878652409c-480x270-gif/giphy(11).gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Netflix </em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Beginning today, the US is <a href="https://apnews.com/article/coronavirus-pandemic-lifestyle-business-travel-health-f21e8951510d04b40aa9bc9a5cb8d07c?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">relaxing its restrictions</a> on nonessential international travel for the first time since the pandemic began.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Visitors must be vaccinated by a shot approved by the FDA or WHO, and must present a negative Covid test within 72 hours of departure. There are a few exceptions for youngsters and people who live in countries where vaccines aren’t as accessible.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For families who haven’t seen each other in years, this is a big deal.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For industries that rely on international travel, this is also a big deal.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><strong style="color:#000">Airlines </strong></span><span>are relieved that their critical transatlantic routes will return. Pre-Covid, British Airways </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-11-07/u-s-flights-reopen-handing-british-airways-1-billion-lifeline?srnd=premium" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">booked $1 billion</a></span><span> in revenue for flights between London Heathrow and New York’s JFK airport—the most lucrative route in the world, per Bloomberg.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><strong style="color:#000">Hospitality: </strong></span><span>Home rental platform VRBO reported an increase of </span><span><a href="https://www.travelandleisure.com/travel-news/us-travel-restrictions-lifting-november-8?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more than 160% </a></span><span>in searches for US vacation homes by foreign travelers since the announcement was made, according to Travel + Leisure.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><strong style="color:#000">Retailers </strong></span><span>hope international travelers will </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/11/07/retailers-hail-lifting-of-travel-ban-return-of-international-tourists-with-hopes-of-sales-rebound.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">give a boost</a></span><span> to what’s already expected to be a record holiday shopping season. Of all shopping fueled by travel and tourism in 2019, global travelers accounted for 27%, per the International Trade Administration.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>The relaxation of the travel ban will mend the US' strained relationship with Europe, which has allowed Americans to visit for months but didn’t get reciprocity.</p>
</div>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">

<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>On the day following the New York City Marathon, the New York Times’s city edition sees a boost in retail sales of <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/live/2021/11/07/sports/nyc-marathon-live-updates?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew#a-new-york-times-tradition-continues-the-finishers-names-in-print" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">nearly 50%</a> over a typical Monday. That’s because the paper prints a list of the names and finish times of as many of the marathon’s runners as it can, a tradition that began in 1994. About 30,000 people ran this year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“Big Bird is a communist.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Arizona State Senator Wendy Rogers, a conservative, <a href="https://twitter.com/WendyRogersAZ/status/1457436254711259138?s=20" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">weighed in</a> on a <a href="https://twitter.com/BigBird/status/1456971880666046465?s=20" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tweet</a> by Big Bird that promoted Covid-19 vaccines for kids. And Oscar is clearly a libertarian. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>A stunning look inside the fast-food workers’ season of rebellion. (<a href="https://wapo.st/3o5yiTz?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Washington Post</a>)</p>
</div>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CALENDAR
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/07/the-week-ahead-november-8?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Week Ahead
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Starbucks union: </strong>Employees at three Buffalo, NY, area Starbucks shops will <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-11-07/starbucks-union-vote-sets-up-a-watershed-moment-for-u-s-labor?srnd=premium" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">begin voting</a> on whether to unionize on Wednesday. It’ll be closely watched nationwide, as Starbucks remains one of the most famous nonunion companies in the US.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">E-IPO: </strong>Rivian, considered the pack leader of recent EV startups, could <a href="https://www.reuters.com/business/autos-transportation/ev-startup-rivian-targets-6311-billion-valuation-ipo-2021-11-05/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">go public</a> this week...and it’ll be one to watch. Seeking a valuation of up to $65 billion, Rivian will be in the same league as legacy carmakers Ford ($77b) and GM ($85b). It’s looking to raise a mammoth $10 billion in the IPO.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Inflation data: </strong>October’s Consumer Price Index, which drops Wednesday, is expected to show the biggest increase in prices yet since the pandemic began.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Earnings: </strong>We’re in the back half of earnings season, but big names are still reporting this week, including PayPal, AMC, Coinbase, Palantir, and Disney. Curious to learn more about AMC’s <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/11/04/amc-to-sell-popcorn-at-mall-kiosks-supermarkets-in-2022.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pivot to popcorn</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Everything else:</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Veterans Day is on Thursday.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The COP26 climate conference rolls into its second week.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><em>Red Notice</em></span><span>, starring Dwayne Johnson, Ryan Reynolds, and Gal Gadot, hits Netflix on Friday.</span>
</li>
</ul>
</div>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

The Puzzle Section

<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Turntable: </strong>You can make 32 words from the jumble in today’s Turntable puzzle. Can you get them all? <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/07/turntable-november-8?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Play it here,</a> then send it to your coworkers for a little friendly competition.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Leaderboard</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The following cities are the top-ranked for which category?</p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Utrecht, Netherlands</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Zwolle, Netherlands</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Groningen, Netherlands</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Amsterdam, Netherlands</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Provincetown, Massachusetts</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Copenhagen, Denmark</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Sevilla, Spain</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Gatineau, Quebec</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Longueuil, Quebec</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Montreal, Quebec</span></li>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nAUTO \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/07/elon-musk-posts-twitter-poll-asking-if-he-should-sell-10-of-his-tesla-shares?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\n2021 in a Headline \n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/07/elon-musk-posts-twitter-poll-asking-if-he-should-sell-10-of-his-tesla-shares?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt='Headline saying \"Twitter has spoken: Musk should sell $21 billion Tesla stake\" ' style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/bedd537195afe0a61500f960cb35cd44676216fb-2048x1897.png?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eScreenshot of Bloomberg.com \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e*Record Scratch* *Freeze Frame* You’re probably wondering how we got here.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Saturday, Elon Musk proposed selling 10% of his Tesla stock, which is worth roughly $21 billion. And instead of, you know, consulting with advisors or lawyers, he did it the Elon Musk way: by creating a \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1457064697782489088?s=20\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epoll on Twitter\u003c/a\u003e and asking his followers to vote. He said he would “abide by the results of this poll.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e3.5 million votes later, and 58% of respondents said he should sell.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSo what happens next?\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf Musk sticks to his word and unloads the stock, then he could end up with long-term capital gains tax liability of \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/RyanRadia/status/1457437788639571984?s=20\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$6.69 billion\u003c/a\u003e, according to estimates by economics researcher Ryan Radia. Can you think of a bigger individual tax bill in history? We can’t.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTesla’s stock price will be interesting to watch this morning, but experts say Musk’s $21 billion tweet may not be too much of a curveball for current shareholders, because his intentions to sell some of his Tesla shares \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/11/06/elon-musk-is-using-a-twitter-poll-to-decide-the-future-of-his-tesla-stock.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eare well known\u003c/a\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSpeaking at the Code Conference in September, Musk said he’d sell a “huge block” of his expiring stock options in Q4.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAnd two weeks ago he said he’d sell $6 billion worth of stock and donate it to the UN’s World Food Programme (WFP), provided they open their books and prove that that amount would end world hunger.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eReading between the lines: \u003c/strong\u003eMusk appears to have already made up his mind about selling Tesla stock, but he wanted to have some fun on Twitter before doing it.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe tax angle\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMusk’s rising fortune ($338 billion at last count) has been the focus of a proposed “\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/26/undefined?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebillionaire’s tax\u003c/a\u003e” that would hit the unrealized gains of the richest 700 or so Americans. While that proposal faces an uphill battle in Congress, it reflects growing concern about tax avoidance by the top 0.01%, whose riches are tied up in investments that aren’t taxed until they’re sold.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSen. Ron Wyden, who introduced the billionaire’s tax, said, “Whether or not the world’s wealthiest man pays any taxes at all shouldn’t depend on the results of a Twitter poll.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nWhy the BIF Is a BFD\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe House \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/house-approves-infrastructure-bill-36cc16f0-480e-402a-a260-ff17976184f7.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epassed\u003c/a\u003e the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act, known as BIF, late Friday night, putting an end to the long-running joke that Congress could never close the deal on an infrastructure bill. It’ll head to President Biden’s desk for his signature.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy it matters: \u003c/strong\u003eIf the supply chain mayhem has taught us anything, it’s that the economic machine can’t function without the right nuts and bolts in place. The Business Roundtable, an influential group of US execs, called the bill “vital for the economy” and urged its passage.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePlus, even in an era where Democrats and Republicans are going at it like rival San Diego TV stations, the bill earned bipartisan support. In the summer, the Senate passed it on a 69–30 vote.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBIF 101: \u003c/strong\u003eThe bill provides $550 billion in new funding for infrastructure projects like bridges, broadband, and EV charging stations—and represents the biggest federal investment in infrastructure in more than a decade. It’ll be paid for mostly by Covid relief funds that haven’t been spent and a crackdown on taxes for crypto trading.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ewith Part 1 of their economic agenda done and dusted, Democrats turn to Part 2: the $1.75 trillion social spending bill. Before voting, lawmakers are waiting to hear from the nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office about how much it would cost American taxpayers.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-11-07/u-s-flights-reopen-handing-british-airways-1-billion-lifeline?srnd=premium\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebooked $1 billion\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in revenue for flights between London Heathrow and New York’s JFK airport—the most lucrative route in the world, per Bloomberg.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong
